meanings.definition: Not capable of being declined or varied in form.
meanings.sent1: The shape of a circle is indeclinable; it always remains the same.
meanings.sent2: The mountain's height is indeclinable; it does not change over time.
meanings.sent3: The robot's indeclinable design made it impossible to transform into anything else.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as indeclinable as the North Star, unwavering and constant.
meanings.sent5: The indeclinable truth of nature is that the sun will rise every morning without fail.

meanings.definition: Not subject to decline or decrease.
meanings.sent1: His enthusiasm for the project was indeclinable; it only grew stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent2: The company's profits remained indeclinable despite the economic downturn.
meanings.sent3: The indeclinable supply of cookies in the jar mysteriously never seemed to diminish.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was indeclinable, like a sturdy oak tree standing tall through all seasons.
meanings.sent5: The indeclinable bond between mother and child is unbreakable and enduring.

meanings.sent1: The indeclinable pattern on the wallpaper repeated itself without any alteration.
meanings.sent2: The temperature in the room remained indeclinable, neither rising nor falling.
meanings.sent3: The indeclinable routine of his daily life became a source of comfort and stability.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as indeclinable as a melody that never strayed from its original tune.
meanings.sent5: The indeclinable rhythm of the waves crashing on the shore lulled her into a peaceful sleep.
